result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrew J. SCHLIDT was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC-2nd or subsequent offense [Modifiers: Second/Subsequent Drug Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Complete mental health assessment.

timeConds.notes:
Thirty (30) days up front, under the Huber Law.  Court authorizes transfer to another neighboring county around Milwaukee for purposes of employment, but NOT Milwaukee County.  
Additional twenty (20) days, imposed and stayed to be imposed upon the agent's discretion.

records.addlTxt:
Possess THC, 2nd or subsequent offense - Guilty plea.   Convicted.   Court orders defenant to submit DNA sample.   Sentencing hearing is set for 06-12-17 at 3:00 p.m.   
Minutes.
Plea date on April 27, 2017 at 02:30 pm.
Letter from Attorney Larson indicating that she no longer represents the defendant in this matter.

Request, Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorneys.
Cover letter.
$50.00 cash bail furnished and defendant is released from custody.

BAIL HEARING -
Defendant in custody on bench warrant and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The matter is continued for a plea date on 04-06-17 at 1:30 p.m.  Bail is set at $50.00 cash.  Bail furnished and the defendant released from custody.
Bench warrant with service of officer thereon.
Minutes.

Warrant served.
Defendant in custody in Milwaukee County.
$200.18 WARRANT FEES
All records scanned and verified.

Defendant failed to appear for a plea date.
State requests warrant.
Court authorizes warrant.

Letter from Attorney Larson to Judge Rohrer.
Defendant's Motion in Limine.
Pre-trial conference on October 27, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial on November 2, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea date on June 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Status conference on May 10, 2016 at 01:45 pm.

Settlement Conference Summary.
Settlement conference with District Attorney is reset to 03-31-16 at 11:30 a.m.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 1 for further proceedings.  Waiver of Right to Preliminary Hearing.  
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.  Not guilty plea.  Jury Calendar.  Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 02-18-16 at 1:30 p.m.   State's Motion and Demand for Discovery.
Minutes.
Preliminary hearing at 01-13-2016 01:30 pm
Resubmitting request for substitution of Judge.

Ann Larson, public defender.

Defendant requests counsel and is referred to the public defender.   Initial appearance is reset to 11-23-15 at 2:30 p.m.   Bail is set at $500.00 recognizance bond.   Bail furnished.
